Journal.Title: Huan jing ke xue= Huanjing kexue

Article.ArticleTitle: [Variation of O<sub>3</sub> Concentration in Different Regions of Beijing from 2006-2015].

AbstractText: O<sub>3</sub> continuous monitoring data for the Dingling, Guanyuan, Liulihe, and Qianmen sites from 2006-2015 were analyzed to investigate concentration levels, variation trends, temporal variations, and relationships with precursors and meteorological factors. The results showed that the ten year average concentrations of O<sub>3</sub> at the Dingling site were the highest at 65.2 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>, followed by concentrations at Liulihe (53.4 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>), Guanyuan (49.6 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>) and Qianmen (40.4 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>). The O<sub>3</sub> concentrations at Dingling showed a decreasing trend[0.5 μg·(m<sup>3</sup>·a)<sup>-1</sup>], while O<sub>3</sub> concentrations at Guanyuan[0.9 μg·(m<sup>3</sup>·a)<sup>-1</sup>], Liulihe[0.3 μg·(m<sup>3</sup>·a)<sup>-1</sup>], and Qianmen[0.3 μg·(m<sup>3</sup>·a)<sup>-1</sup>] showed an increasing trend. The highest monthly average concentrations appeared during June and August, and the highest frequency occurred in July (17 times) with average concentrations of 99.8 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>. The lowest monthly average concentrations appeared during November and February, and the highest frequency occurred in January (14 times) with an average concentration of 16.6 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>. Notably, the time for the peak concentrations of O<sub>3</sub> appeared earlier in the day in recent years. The peak concentrations of O<sub>3</sub> appeared at 15:00-16:00 during 2013-2015, which was 1-2 hours earlier than previous years. The heavy air pollution of O<sub>3</sub> occurred on 11 days at the Dingling site in 2015, which was ten days more than in 2013, indicating O<sub>3</sub> pollution in the downwind suburban regions of Beijing in summer became more and more serious. The concentrations of O<sub>3</sub> and NO<sub>2</sub> at Dingling showed a positive correlation, while the concentrations of O<sub>3</sub> and NO<sub>2</sub> at the other sites showed a negative correlation, indicating O<sub>3</sub> formation in Dingling was sensitive to NO<sub>2</sub> chemistry, while O<sub>3</sub> formation at the other sites was sensitive to VOC chemistry. The concentrations of O<sub>3</sub> showed a positive correlation with temperature and negative correlations with humidity and surface pressure. Temperature had the greatest influence on O<sub>3</sub> concentration, followed by surface pressure and humidity. For cases when daily maximum temperature exceeded 30℃ and relative humidity was between 30% and 70%, the probability of the O<sub>3</sub> daily maximum 8 h concentration exceeding 200 μg·m<sup>-3</sup> was high, indicating the air quality level reached levels for light pollution and moderate pollution.
